20110103230116.000|20110103230119.000|TR0|Enterprise.  The Navy now investigating

20110103230146.000|20110103230148.000|TR0| Well, Wolf, it was first said that the 
20110103230148.000|20110103230150.000|TR0|Navy videos were humorous skits about 
20110103230150.000|20110103230152.000|TR0|training. But when you see this material, 
20110103230152.000|20110103230155.000|TR0|it's hard to think what anybody was 
20110103230155.000|20110103230157.000|TR0|training for.

20110103230208.000|20110103230210.000|TR0|CAPT. OWEN HONORS, U.S. NAVY:  This 
20110103230210.000|20110103230213.000|TR0|evening, all of you bleeding hearts and 
20110103230213.000|20110103230215.000|TR0|you (EXPLETIVE DELETED) boy, why don't you 
20110103230215.000|20110103230217.000|TR0|just go ahead and hug yourselves for the 
20110103230217.000|20110103230219.000|TR0|next 20 minutes or so, because there's a 
20110103230219.000|20110103230222.000|TR0|really good chance you're going to be 
20110103230222.000|20110103230224.000|TR0|offended tonight.
20110103230224.000|20110103230226.000|TR0|
20110103230226.000|20110103230228.000|TR0|STARR:  This is Captain Owen Honors in 
20110103230228.000|20110103230231.000|TR0|2006 and 2007, when he was second in 
20110103230231.000|20110103230233.000|TR0|command on the aircraft carrier USS 
20110103230233.000|20110103230235.000|TR0|Enterprise.  He made several lewd videos 
20110103230235.000|20110103230237.000|TR0|with anti-gay slurs, as well as slowing 
20110103230237.000|20110103230240.000|TR0|simulated sex acts and repeatedly used the 
20110103230240.000|20110103230242.000|TR0|F-word.
20110103230242.000|20110103230244.000|TR0|
20110103230244.000|20110103230246.000|TR0|HONORS:  Finally, let's get to my favorite 
20110103230246.000|20110103230249.000|TR0|topic and something foreign to the gay kid 
20110103230249.000|20110103230251.000|TR0|over there: chicks in the shower.
20110103230251.000|20110103230253.000|TR0|
20110103230253.000|20110103230255.000|TR0|This is certainly the most popular video 
20110103230255.000|20110103230258.000|TR0|of any of the X.O. movie videos.  It's 
20110103230258.000|20110103230300.000|TR0|also the one that has landed me with the 
20110103230300.000|20110103230302.000|TR0|most complaints.
20110103230302.000|20110103230304.000|TR0|
20110103230304.000|20110103230307.000|TR0|STARR:  Honors was verbally reprimanded 
20110103230307.000|20110103230309.000|TR0|when the tapes were made, but now, after 
20110103230309.000|20110103230311.000|TR0|watching the videos, top Navy brass has 
20110103230311.000|20110103230313.000|TR0|launched an investigation in part to find 
20110103230313.000|20110103230316.000|TR0|out how the videos were made and shown to 
20110103230316.000|20110103230318.000|TR0|the ship's crew of 6,000 without senior 
20110103230318.000|20110103230320.000|TR0|officers speaking up and stopping it all.
20110103230320.000|20110103230322.000|TR0|

20110103230325.000|20110103230327.000|TR0|got the videos from an unidentified

20110103230331.000|20110103230334.000|TR0|said they were offended.

20110103230533.000|20110103230535.000|TR0|BRIAN TODD, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Wolf, 
20110103230535.000|20110103230537.000|TR0|former Navy personnel have told us the 
20110103230537.000|20110103230540.000|TR0|majority of time, the atmosphere on board 
20110103230540.000|20110103230542.000|TR0|these vessels is very professional.  But 
20110103230542.000|20110103230544.000|TR0|they say if you have been out at sea a 
20110103230544.000|20110103230546.000|TR0|long time, and it's sometimes several 
20110103230546.000|20110103230549.000|TR0|months at a time for these carrier groups, 
20110103230549.000|20110103230551.000|TR0|the humor, the practical jokes can get 
20110103230551.000|20110103230553.000|TR0|lewd.

20110103230625.000|20110103230627.000|TR0|We asked former Navy personnel what they 
20110103230627.000|20110103230629.000|TR0|thought of the lewd video featuring Navy 
20110103230629.000|20110103230632.000|TR0|Captain Owen Honors, then the executive 
20110103230632.000|20110103230634.000|TR0|officer of the aircraft carrier Enterprise.
20110103230634.000|20110103230636.000|TR0|
20110103230636.000|20110103230638.000|TR0|Retired Petty Officer John Powers was in 
20110103230638.000|20110103230641.000|TR0|the Navy for 20 years and served long 
20110103230641.000|20110103230643.000|TR0|deployments on two carriers.  He says the 
20110103230643.000|20110103230645.000|TR0|atmosphere is usually professional, but 
20110103230645.000|20110103230647.000|TR0|sometimes the jokes get out of hand.  He 
20110103230647.000|20110103230650.000|TR0|describes one practical joke he saw on 
20110103230650.000|20110103230652.000|TR0|someone who the crew believed was a devil 
20110103230652.000|20110103230654.000|TR0|worshiper.
20110103230654.000|20110103230656.000|TR0|
20110103230656.000|20110103230659.000|TR0|PETTY OFFICER JOHN POWERS (RET.), U.S. 
20110103230659.000|20110103230701.000|TR0|NAVY:  They ended up taking him down to 
20110103230701.000|20110103230703.000|TR0|one of the DFM pump rooms, hung him 
20110103230703.000|20110103230705.000|TR0|upside-down, tied.  They pissed on him, 
20110103230705.000|20110103230708.000|TR0|urinated on him, stuck a bolt up his butt, 
20110103230708.000|20110103230710.000|TR0|greased him down, then let him go, and 
20110103230710.000|20110103230712.000|TR0|performed an exorcism on him.
20110103230712.000|20110103230714.000|TR0|
20110103230714.000|20110103230717.000|TR0|TODD:  But Powers says that was the worst 
20110103230717.000|20110103230719.000|TR0|thing he saw.  Most of the jokes he says 
20110103230719.000|20110103230721.000|TR0|were more innocuous, like fraternity 
20110103230721.000|20110103230723.000|TR0|initiations.
20110103230723.000|20110103230726.000|TR0|
20110103230726.000|20110103230728.000|TR0|(on camera):  The former Navy officers who 
20110103230728.000|20110103230730.000|TR0|we spoke to outside the Navy Yard here in 
20110103230730.000|20110103230732.000|TR0|Washington say that, in these long 
20110103230732.000|20110103230735.000|TR0|deployments, practical jokes and raunchy 
20110103230735.000|20110103230737.000|TR0|humor are certainly not uncommon, but this 
20110103230737.000|20110103230739.000|TR0|kind of video is something they hadn't 
20110103230739.000|20110103230741.000|TR0|seen before.
20110103230741.000|20110103230744.000|TR0|
20110103230744.000|20110103230746.000|TR0|Retired Navy Reserve Captain Greg Horne, 
20110103230746.000|20110103230748.000|TR0|who served on two destroyers and would 
20110103230748.000|20110103230750.000|TR0|spend several months away from home at a 
20110103230750.000|20110103230753.000|TR0|time, says loneliness and tension often 
20110103230753.000|20110103230755.000|TR0|increase when a ship has been at sea for a 
20110103230755.000|20110103230757.000|TR0|long period, but:
20110103230757.000|20110103230759.000|TR0|
20110103230759.000|20110103230802.000|TR0|CAPT. GREG HORNE (RET.), U.S. NAVY:  I 
20110103230802.000|20110103230804.000|TR0|would not try to paint any X.O. of being 
20110103230804.000|20110103230806.000|TR0|responsible for coming up with something 
20110103230806.000|20110103230808.000|TR0|like that to improve morale of the troops. 
20110103230808.000|20110103230811.000|TR0| I just don't see it.  I don't see that 
20110103230811.000|20110103230813.000|TR0|kind of behavior.  It's unbecoming.

20110103230831.000|20110103230833.000|TR0| Some said, with everything going on, on

20110103230938.000|20110103230941.000|TR0|impressive people on a vessel full of

20110103230947.000|20110103230950.000|TR0|have 6,000 people on them sometimes -- is 
20110103230950.000|20110103230952.000|TR0|amazing.  It's 24/7.  The X.O. has to keep 
20110103230952.000|20110103230954.000|TR0|on top of all of this.  Some people said 
20110103230954.000|20110103230956.000|TR0|they were surprised that, if this guy made 
20110103230956.000|20110103230959.000|TR0|these videos, that he even has time to do

20110103231003.000|20110103231005.000|TR0|carriers.  It's unbelievable.

20110103231023.000|20110103231026.000|TR0|TODD:  Sure.
20110103231026.000|20110103231028.000|TR0|
20110103231028.000|20110103231030.000|TR0|BLITZER:  From ships at sea to rocking the 
20110103231030.000|20110103231032.000|TR0|boat on Capitol Hill. Within the past 
20110103231032.000|20110103231035.000|TR0|hour, we have learned that Republicans 
20110103231035.000|20110103231037.000|TR0|will, in fact, launch an effort to repeal 
20110103231037.000|20110103231039.000|TR0|the health care reform law almost

20110103231810.000|20110103231812.000|TR0|another, that's what USA Today dubs the 
20110103231812.000|20110103231814.000|TR0|year 2010, in light of the unprecedented 
20110103231814.000|20110103231816.000|TR0|use of technology.
20110103231816.000|20110103231819.000|TR0|
20110103231819.000|20110103231821.000|TR0|We are awash in technology -- 93 percent 
20110103231821.000|20110103231823.000|TR0|of Americans now use cell phones or 
20110103231823.000|20110103231825.000|TR0|wireless devices.  And a third of those 
20110103231825.000|20110103231828.000|TR0|people are using so-called smartphones.  
20110103231828.000|20110103231830.000|TR0|That means the users can browse the Web, 
20110103231830.000|20110103231832.000|TR0|check their e-mail, text people, do all 
20110103231832.000|20110103231834.000|TR0|kind of stuff on their phone.
20110103231834.000|20110103231837.000|TR0|
20110103231837.000|20110103231839.000|TR0|According to an industry trade group, from 
20110103231839.000|20110103231841.000|TR0|June 2009 to June 2010, cell phone 
20110103231841.000|20110103231843.000|TR0|subscribers sent 1.8 trillion text 
20110103231843.000|20110103231846.000|TR0|messages.  That was up 33 percent from the 
20110103231846.000|20110103231848.000|TR0|year before.
20110103231848.000|20110103231850.000|TR0|
20110103231850.000|20110103231852.000|TR0|In other words, most of us spend our days

20110103231908.000|20110103231910.000|TR0|ago crossed the line as to where doing

20110103231913.000|20110103231915.000|TR0|calls while they're out to dinner, using
